intro: Banisteriopsis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bignay, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, fleshy berries. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
